column4: thats way complicated. install and run xming, install putty, set putty to accept frowarded x and do what you gotta do
that does not set the display and all, and is mingw that easy to find ?!? i found cygwin more userfriendly
it gives an x server to run forwarded apps, what more do you want?
can you expand on that any? http://www.straightrunning.com/candidate/Xming-7-4-0-2-setup.exe  for xmiing
i had it be4 cygwin, i found the cygwin one was better integrated
integrated into what?
it's been 4yrs be4, just didn't give it another chance, so maybe things have changed
yep, xming does that, apps look like they are running on windows
you dont see the full fake x server unless you set it to show
me too only my work lappy is xp based but im over it
never had a network timeout...
i was fed up with windoze's useless waitstates ;) So one day i decided why cope with that
its extremely custom software that i test in ncitrix
so i need windows, plus after work i shutdown and jump on my own systems
i guess there's no citrix client software availlable for linux than ? That sucks ! It's just X for windoze based programs ;)
i think their is but what i have works so im not gonna fix it, ive got too many servers to firefight
i know what you mean, but you could run windows in a virtual machine 4 that...
whats the point, thats more bloat in ram running 2 OSes
i see, what a jackass isn't he ? Patience...
i have no problem with windows for my work pc
well me neither, but network timeouts when poping up explorer and stuff like that wore me down
Sure ;) Tc and goodnite, i really gotta go now
